intro: Ganymedes cernuus, commonly known as the drooping ganymede, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its soft, hairy leaves and clusters of small, yellow flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, well-drained soils and thrives in partial to full sun. Its blooming period occurs during the summer months, attracting various pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Ganymedes cernuus is often used in ornamental gardening for its delicate appearance and resilience in temperate climates.
